statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: NAISMITH MEMORIAL HALL OF FAME TIP-OFF

article.description: Marqueese Grayson and Joe Cremo combined to score 39 points -- including nine in the final 37 seconds -- and Albany overcame an 11-point, second-have deficit to beat Brown 80-76 in the Naismith M
article.headline: Grayson, Cremo help Albany rally for 80-76 win over Brown
article.linkText: Grayson, Cremo help Albany rally for 80-76 win over Brown
article.story: UNCASVILLE, Conn. -- Marqueese Grayson and Joe Cremo combined to score 39 points -- including nine in the final 37 seconds -- and Albany overcame an 11-point, second-have deficit to beat Brown 80-76 in the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame Tip-Off on Sunday night. Grayson hit three 3-pointers and finished with 21 points while Cremo made 10 of 10 foul shots and scored 18. Greig Stire added 14 points and 12 rebounds. Grayson's 3 with 37 seconds left stopped a 7-0 run by Brown and gave the Great Danes (3-2) a 74-69 lead. Tavon Blackmon and Obi Okolie made layups for the Bears, but Cremo hit two free throws after each to make it 78-73 with 15 seconds to go. Okolie hit a 3-pointer 10 seconds later, but Grayson made two free throws to seal it. Steven Spieth scored 25 -- his fourth-consecutive game with 20-plus points -- for Brown (1-4). Albany committed 11 first-half turnovers as the Bears took a 39-30 lead into the break and Joshua Howard's layup with 16:01 remaining gave Brown a 47-36 lead. But Albany scored 19 of the next 20 points and Brown didn't make another field goal until Okolie's layup more than 12 minutes later.
